title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
01:03 <mflorea> has quit  
01:29 <cjdelisle> has joined #xwiki  
04:46 <krutoileshii> has joined #xwiki  
05:16 <DrLou> has quit  
05:28 <krutoileshii> has quit  
07:00 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
07:03 <Denis> has quit  
07:37 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
07:44 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:50 <Denis1> is now known as <Denis>  
08:57 <mflorea> has quit  
09:05 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:18 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
09:42 <vmassol> mflorea: good morning. Have you already documented somewhere the new sheet system?  
09:43 <vmassol> I'm running latest XE and looking at XWiki.XWikiUsers objects  
09:43 <vmassol> I can see a ClassSheetBinding which I can understand  
09:43 <vmassol> but there's also a DocumentSheetBinding and this one I'm not sure what it is about  
09:44 <vmassol> btw there's a bug in the UI  
09:45 <vmassol> https://skitch.com/e-vmassol/f5yt8/editing-object-for-xwiki-user-class  
09:45 <vmassol> not sure when this regression has been introduced  
09:45 <vmassol> (the bug is that the HTML is displayed)  
09:49 <vmassol> evalica: good morning. I've noticed that on the user profile page there's a title level 2 only for the profile tab and not for the other tabs. This looks unconsistent. WDYT?  
10:17 <+mflorea> vmassol: I'll document the new sheet system after I fix the tests. I'll look into the object editor issue with HTML  
10:17 <vmassol> mflorea: yes fixing all tests is higher priority I agree  
10:25 <sdumitriu> has quit  
10:26 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
10:31 <evalica> has quit  
10:34 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
10:39 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
11:03 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
11:05 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:15 <Flaviusx> has joined #xwiki  
11:15 <tmortagne> has quit  
11:16 <Flaviusx> hi, any ideea why custom display for properties is generating a paragraph? using XE 3.1  
11:17 <vmassol> Flaviusx: if all you want is a property value you should never use get or display()  
11:18 <vmassol> you should getProperty().getValue()  
11:18 <vmassol> get() and display() generate HTML  
11:18 <Flaviusx> no, i think i found the issue  
11:19 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
11:19 <Flaviusx> i was using {{html}} in custom display without clean="false"  
11:19 <vmassol> clean = false is usually bad btw  
11:20 <vmassol> (since it means you could generate invalid XHTML)  
11:20 <Flaviusx> yes but, otherwise i get a paragraph around what i want to generate from custom display  
11:20 <Flaviusx> {{velocity}}{{html clean="false"}}#if($hasAdmin && $context.action == 'edit' || $context.action == 'inline')<input type='text' id='$prefix$name' name='$prefix$name' value='$value'>#else<input type='text' id='$prefix$name' name='$prefix$name' value='$value' disabled="disabled">#end{{/html}}{{/velocity}}  
11:20 <vmassol> where do you access a property here?  
11:21 <Flaviusx> \* $xwiki.getDocument($context.user).display("last\_name")  
11:21 <vmassol> what is the type of last\_name?  
11:21 <vmassol> string I guess  
11:22 <vmassol> since it's not a textarea IMO you should use getProperty().getValue()  
11:22 <vmassol> I think we need have some training about this since almost everyone makes the mistake of abusing get/display  
11:28 <Flaviusx> i don't want the value, i want the input generated  
11:29 <vmassol> in inline mode  
11:29 <vmassol> but not in view mode  
11:29 <Flaviusx> yes  
11:29 <Flaviusx> yes  
11:29 <Flaviusx> custom inputs for example, so basically instead of using a macro with getValue, i want to be automatically generated using custom display field  
11:44 <+tmortagne> any idea what javassist is used for ? It's a compile dependency of oldcore but it not used anywhere in code, is it a runtime dependency ?  
11:45 <vmassol> it's used by several jboss fraemworks aFAIK  
11:46 <+tmortagne> same thing for  
11:46 <+tmortagne> \* graffito-jcr-mapping: I don't see how this one could be a runtime dependency since as far as I understand it's a query API and not some hidden implementation of something  
11:46 <+tmortagne> \* jta  
11:46 <+tmortagne> \* batik-codec  
11:46 <+tmortagne> \* yuicompressor  
11:46 <+tmortagne> \* picocontainer  
11:46 <+tmortagne> \* axis  
11:46 <+tmortagne> all that in oldcore  
11:46 <+tmortagne> isn't yuicompressor something used for JS ?  
11:48 <+tmortagne> for jta there is a comment from sdumitriu asking is this is really needed so it seems i'm not the only one  
11:50 <+tmortagne> not sure it's right to depends on xercesImpl in oldcore especially as compile depedency, that should be a distribution choice IMO  
12:10 <vmassol> so cool: https://skitch.com/e-vmassol/f5bkr/skitch  
12:19 <+Enygma`> is that the GSoC work from this summer? :)  
12:40 <vmassol> yes  
12:41 <+sburjan> tmortagne: around ?  
12:43 <+sburjan> I am running on the latest snapshot (xwiki-enterprise-jetty-hsqldb-3.2-20110922.080046-462.zip ) and I get errors when starting XWiki. Error is : org.reflections.ReflectionsException: could not create Dir using org.reflections.vfs.Vfs$DefaultUrlTypes$2 from url jar:file:/home/sorinello/Desktop/XWiki/XWiki%203.2/xwiki-enterprise-jetty-hsqldb-3.2-SNAPSHOT/webapps/xwiki/WEB-INF/lib/xwiki-platform-extension-api-3.2-SNAPSHOT.jar!/ . Itseems that  
12:43 <+sburjan> the space " " in URL issue is not fixed  
13:22 <+sburjan> does anybody know how long a cache id is stored in the cache macro ?  
13:22 <vmassol> 5mn  
13:23 <vmassol> but it's not the id that is cached  
13:23 <vmassol> it's the content  
13:23 <vmassol> (the XDOM of teh rendered content to be rpecise)  
13:23 <+sburjan> i know. the id is for identification. usecase: I use cache macro, and I edit a page. My changes are not visible in view mode until I change the cache id  
13:23 <vmassol> if you change the id you'll get a refresh  
13:23 <vmassol> yes  
13:24 <+sburjan> yepp. And I was curious how long the old id is still stored  
13:24 <+sburjan> even if not used  
13:24 <vmassol> this is not documented btw?  
13:24 <vmassol> it is!  
13:24 <vmassol> http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Cache+Macro  
13:25 <+sburjan> thanks, skipped that section  
13:25 <vmassol> funny since it's hilighted :)  
13:26 <+sburjan> :)  
13:32 <+tmortagne> sburjan: do you get errors on other jars than this one ? I think it's something else actually but it was supposed to be fixed it's weird  
13:32 <+sburjan> let me pastebin it  
13:33 <+sburjan> tmortagne: http://pastebin.com/nCHYgzYY  
13:34 <+tmortagne> yep that's it, not sure why it's failing but it's not the code extension loader, it's licenses loader but it was supposed to be fixed too  
13:34 <+tmortagne> checking, maybe there is several places to hack  
13:35 <+tmortagne> hope they will release a fix quickly, it's a pain  
13:36 <+tmortagne> crap it's another place...  
13:36 <+tmortagne> I think I will deploy a patched version  
13:37 <+tmortagne> but they don't have tags (otherwise it's not funny)  
13:39 <+sburjan> vmassol: is the 3.0 branch still supported. I found a critical issue on 3.0.1 on IE9. related to WYSIWYG .. is it worth reporting it in JIRA ? or we won't have a 3.0.2  
13:40 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
13:41 <Flaviusx> has quit  
13:43 <vmassol> hmmm  
13:44 <+sburjan> this issue doesn't seem to be a regression, but it is similar to a fixed issue: XWIKI-5583 .But in 3.0.1's case it doesn't load at all :)  
13:44 <+sburjan> (I am testing 3.0.1 ATM)  
13:44 <vmassol> so the short answer is that once 3.2 is released we won't support 3.0 anymore  
13:44 <vmassol> actually wait  
13:45 <vmassol> we're already not supporting 3.0  
13:45 <vmassol> we're currentl supporting 3.2-SNAP + 3.1  
13:45 <+sburjan> yes, this is why I asked, to know if is still worth reporting it  
13:45 <vmassol> now  
13:45 <+tmortagne> if it's in 3.1 too then yes should be reported but it's not going to be fixed in 3.0 branch IMO  
13:45 <vmassol> anyone is free to perform a bug fix release of any past version  
13:46 <vmassol> (anyone = any committer)  
13:46 <+sburjan> It's not in 3.1 .  
13:46 <+sburjan> ok, then I won't report it on JIRA  
13:46 <+tmortagne> then as you want, could be useful to reprort it to indicate a workaround for example  
13:47 <+sburjan> ok, It takes 3 minutes to report it :)  reporting it then.. just to have this in our JIRA  
13:47 <vmassol> hmm  
13:47 <vmassol> i think we'll close it immediately as won't fix  
13:48 <vmassol> actually  
13:48 <vmassol> as duplicate  
13:48 <vmassol> since it's already been fixed  
13:48 <vmassol> and there must alreayd be an issue for it  
13:49 <vmassol> so I don't see the point of creating a jira issue  
13:50 <+sburjan> there was an issue. it seems that the fix wasn't applied for 3.0.1  
13:50 <+sburjan> I just created the issue  
13:50 <+sburjan> so you can close it  
13:58 <mflorea> has quit

14:28 <Flaviusx\_> is now known as <Flaviusx>  
14:34 <+sburjan> vmassol: as a curiosity, how toes  the XWiki server that the cache with a certain ID is no longer used .. so it gets deleted after 5 minutes ?  
14:34 <vmassol> we use our cache api  
14:34 <vmassol> which internally uses jboss cache  
14:36 <+tmortagne> sburjan: as long as you know the cache id to can completely configure it in WEB\_INF/ with JBossCache conf files when JBoss impl is used  
14:36 <vmassol> tmortagne: not sure...  
14:36 <vmassol> it's hard coded right now  
14:37 <+sburjan> It must be a complex mechanism in the backend  
14:37 <+tmortagne> vmassol: yes but conf files always win if you really want to change it you can always  
14:37 <vmassol> ah ok didn't know that  
14:37 <+tmortagne> you just need to know the id  
14:38 <vmassol> what's the id in this case? (I don't remember using any id)  
14:38 <+sburjan> yes, but how is it implemented to make XWiki aware that a cache id is no longer user ?  
14:38 <+tmortagne> see http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Cache+Module#HOverwritecacheconfigurationinconfigurationfile28implementationspecific29  
14:39 <evalica> has quit  
14:39 <pturcotte> has joined #xwiki  
14:39 <vmassol> tmortagne: IMO the id is null since I haven't set it ;)  
14:40 <+tmortagne> vmassol: that's because you are not a good citizen  
14:45 <+sburjan> vmassol: did you had the time to look at the email I sent you yesterday ?  
14:45 <vmassol> not yet  
14:45 <vmassol> actually a bit but not enough  
14:46 <vmassol> I'll look at it in a few hours  
14:46 <+sburjan> ok, no hurry  
14:46 <vmassol> will try today  
14:47 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
14:51 <evalica> has joined #xwiki

16:43 <+mflorea> guys, we don't have a build manager for this week.. xwiki-platform build is stuck for the second time  
16:52 <mflorea> has quit  
16:57 <vmassol> right now the BM is jerome  
16:57 <jvelociter> has joined #xwiki  
16:57 <vmassol> jvelociter: marius just left… he was saying: "guys, we don't have a build manager for this week.. xwiki-platform build is stuck for the second time"  
16:58 <vmassol> and I said: "right now the BM is jerome" ;)  
16:58 <+jvelociter> Hi  
16:58 <+jvelociter> I guess I should have pass handled the stick earlier :P  
16:59 <vmassol> up to you  
16:59 <vmassol> :)  
16:59 <vmassol> maybe you liked it so much you want to do 2 weeks!  
17:04 <+jvelociter> Is it normal xwiki-platform is building on agent3 ?  
17:05 <vmassol> yes  
17:05 <vmassol> why not?  
17:05 <+jvelociter> (which is tagged as "android")  
17:05 <vmassol> it has some config for building the gsoc android project  
17:05 <vmassol> so that project is tied to it, but it's not an android-only agent  
17:05 <vmassol> maybe the name is misleading  
17:06 <+jvelociter> k  
17:07 <+jvelociter> do you know the URL for the agent machines ?  
17:07 <+jvelociter> I can't find them  
17:07 <vmassol> hmm seems that checkstyle isn't executed on platform…. checking more  
17:09 <vmassol> actually it's each module's reponsbility to set it up ATM, not very good  
17:09 <vmassol> cjdelisle: do you still have your script to generate checkstyle excludes?  
17:09 <vmassol> :)  
17:14 <sburjan> has quit  
17:15 <@cjdelisle> let me check my .bash\_history, that's where all of my goodies are  
17:20 <@cjdelisle> cat ./buildOut | sed -e '/:[0-9]\*: warning: /d' -e 's/^.\*\/java\/\([^:]\*java\):.\*$/\1,/' > out; cat ./out | sed -e '$!N; /^\(.\*\)\n\1$/!P; D'  
17:20 <vmassol> nice one :)  
17:21 <@cjdelisle> I have no idea what that last bit does, I must have read it somewhere  
17:27 <+jvelociter> FYI Alex is hard restarting agent-3  
17:28 <+jvelociter> (we are not able to connect to it)  
17:28 <vmassol> ouch, ok  
17:56 <+jvelociter> FYI xwiki-platform build just finished properly  
17:56 <+jvelociter> on agent-3  
17:56 <+jvelociter> looks like the reboot helped  
17:56 <vmassol> do we know what happened?  
17:56 <+jvelociter> no  
17:56 <+jvelociter> I'kll try to find out later  
17:56 <+jvelociter> (must finish smtg now)  
17:57 <vmassol> k  
17:57 <vmassol> thanks

22:49 <vmassol> cjdelisle: thanks for your script, done  
22:49 <@cjdelisle> glad it worked, i just picked it out because it looked right

22:53 <pturcotte> has quit  
23:01 <sburjan`> has quit  
23:01 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
23:04 <vmassol> has quit  
23:05 <@sdumitriu> mflorea: Pong  
23:06 <+mflorea> so  
23:06 <+mflorea> I did this change https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/1a3ee42ed23fdebb3c4cf1f6dfb8509535f7786b#diff-5  
23:06 <+mflorea> the important part is that I removed the $obj variable  
23:07 <@sdumitriu> Yep  
23:07 <+mflorea> to my surprise, $obj is used in XWiki.AdminFieldsDisplaySheet  
23:08 <@sdumitriu> Oh  
23:08 <+mflorea> so I broke lots of admin sections  
23:08 <@sdumitriu> Baad  
23:08 <@sdumitriu> It should be set there  
23:08 <+mflorea> ok, good, so we agree :)  
23:09 <+mflorea> because there wasn't any comment on admin.vm saying that $obj will be used later (i.e. it's an API)  
23:09 <+mflorea> I'll set $obj in XWiki.AdminFieldsDisplaySheet then  
23:09 <@sdumitriu> And $obj is not a good variable name  
23:09 <@sdumitriu> But we'll change it later  
23:09 <+mflorea> yep, too generic  
23:09 <@sdumitriu> Yes, +1 for setting it in the sheet  
23:10 <+mflorea> ok, that's all, thanks :)  
23:18 <+sburjan`> :)  
23:59 <mflorea> has quit
